meanings.definition: To distill or purify by repeated boiling and condensing.
meanings.sent1: The alchemist cohobated the potion to make it more potent.
meanings.sent2: The distiller cohobated the liquid to extract its pure essence.
meanings.sent3: The chef cohobated the sauce until it was as clear as crystal.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was cohobated by the challenges she faced.
meanings.sent5: The sun cohobated the water, creating a shimmering mirage on the horizon.

meanings.definition: To purify or refine by repeated distillation.
meanings.sent1: The scientist cohobated the solution to remove impurities.
meanings.sent2: The winemaker cohobated the wine to enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent3: The artist cohobated the colors until they were vibrant and pure.
meanings.sent4: His words were cohobated by honesty and sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The wind cohobated the sand, sculpting intricate patterns in the desert.

meanings.definition: To undergo a process of repeated distillation.
meanings.sent1: The liquid cohobated in the flask, becoming more concentrated.
meanings.sent2: The essence of the herb cohobated as it was distilled multiple times.
meanings.sent3: The idea cohobated in his mind, growing clearer with each thought.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions cohobated, intensifying with every passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The music cohobated in the room, filling the space with harmonious melodies.
